loans.name: Salah

texts.en: Salah is a 19-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He works hard to support his family. He has had a clothing store for 3 years and earns money in this way. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of saving enough money. He is asking for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy ladies clothing goods so he continue working and striving to increase his profit. He hopes to expand his business and open a cosmetic materials store.

loans.use: to buy clothing goods for his business

loans.name: Eufronia

texts.en:
Eufronia is 60 years old, married and has four children.
Eufronia raises hogs in the Philippines. Eufronia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
Eufronia has been raising hogs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Eufronia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwr is from Taiz, Yemen. He is a 29-year-old single man. He used to work as an electrician, where he gained his experience. In 2006, after gaining the needed experience, he established his own electronic shop and gained the respect of his customers. Now his shop is not running perfectly and started earning a lower profit because of low inventory.
He is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER. He will use this loan to buy electronic materials for his business. This loan will enable him to continue providing the family's income and provide them better life conditions

loans.use: to buy electronic materials needed for his business.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 54 years old and married with five children.
Irine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store like coffee, sugar, cooking oil, soy sauce and other groceries.
Irine has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.
Irine aspires to save enough money to expand her business.
.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store like coffee, sugar, cooking oil, soy sauce and other groceries.

loans.name: Balbino De Jesus

texts.es:
Balbino, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de su tienda y asimismo adquirir insumos agricolas para trabajar en la agricultura. Este le permitirá comprar productos para el negocio y materiales agrícolas para trabajar la tierra tales como: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió crecer y tener todo lo necesario para llevar a cabo la actividad en el momento oportuno. Las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que ha obtenido mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Balbino’s asking for a new loan because he needs to invest more in the store as well as to buy farm supplies to work in agriculture.  This will allow him to buy products for the store and farm supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, etc. to work the land.

His previous loan allowed him to grow and to have everything needed to carry out his activity in a timely fashion.  His family circumstances and his economic conditions have improved because he’s earned higher income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store and farm supplies.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past year, Eseza has been working hard to manage her small local brew business, which sells local brew.
To help expand her business, Eseza has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sorghum, millet and some other different drinks such as sodas and beer to sell. This will help Eseza to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. Eseza hopes that in the future she will be able to live a peaceful life.
Eseza is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more sorghum, millet and some other different drinks such as sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en:
Ebrahim is a 26-year-old, single man living in a poor area in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a man who exhibits good moral values, and who is concerned with the well-being of his family.

At this time, he is employed but earning a low salary. He has had a small house for 8 years.  With the salary he earns he pays for the household expenses of his family.

He is requesting a youth loan to buy construction materials, because he is making improvements to his house. He states that he feels happy and grateful to Kiva for the support that he is being provided, because this way he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, because he is making improvements to his house.

loans.name: Deborah's Group

texts.en:
Deborah's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Deborah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 2 years, Deborah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, juice, cooking oil and beans.
To help expand her business, Deborah has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize, rice, sugar, and soap to sell, and will help Deborah to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. Deborah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own.
Deborah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, rice, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Zaina's Group

texts.en:
Zaina's group is comprised of 4 hard working women. Zaina is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 2 years, Zaina has been working hard to manage her small food business, which sells fresh foods.
To help expand her business, Zaina has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food such as bananas, and cassava to sell, and will help Zaina to generate greater profits and expand her business. Zaina hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her economic status.
Zaina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food such as bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Ismet

texts.en:
Ismet is a married 38-year-old father of three children. The oldest is 11 and youngest 6 years old. Ismet is a hard worker and very ambitious person who works a lot to earn a living.
More than a year ago he opened a small restaurant for making kebabs in his area. He usually works from 8:00am until 8:00pm. Ismet is planning to start selling also doner kebabs and pizza.
He has requested a loan to pay for machines to make doner kebabs and pizza as well as a freezer for his small restaurant. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments according to the schedule. He thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to pay for machines to make doner kebabs and pizza, and a freezer.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 19-years-old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Jackline has been working hard to manage her small local brew business, which sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sorghum and millet for making the local brew to sell, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and take care of her self and her child. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a clothing business. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and millet for making the local brew to sell

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansour is 29 years old from Gaza. He has owned a shop selling mobile phones and mobile accessories since 2010.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a new counter for his mobile phone shop.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income to be able to save money and get married.

loans.use: to buy a new counter for his mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past year, Harriet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, juice, cooking oil and beans.
To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize flour, rice, sugar, and soap to sell, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and take care of her young siblings. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her shop and add different goods to sell to her clients.
Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, rice, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas  ,tiene 42 años de edad y esta casada con Edilberto.Posee una vivienda hecha base de adobe donde vive con sus dos hijas .Tiene como principal oficio la producción de cacao orgánico y achiote.Desde niña apoyo a sus padres en labores menores siendo el campo el principal sustento de su familia.Alcanzado la mayoría de edad y al comprometerse con Edilberto quien heredo unas parcelas por parte de sus padres, inicio una vida llena de objetivos por cumplir logrando concretar la compra de otra parcela adicional como producto de sus primeros años de trabajo en pareja.Para un normal desempeño de las tareas agrícolas cuyo fin es de obtener granos de cacao óptimos para su comercialización debe de contar con capital de trabajo ya sea para la contrata de jornaleros o la compra de abono orgánico.
Uno de los principales inconvenientes que aqueja constantemente a sus parcelas es el ataque de plagas netas de su región que perjudica en ocasiones de manera considerable su producción final el cual combate con repelentes naturales hechos a base de barbasco.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y esta agradecida por la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles otorgados planea realizar mejoras a su vivienda iniciando desde las instalaciones de agua, desagüe y mejoras a su techo de calamina , todo ello esperando mejorar su calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 42 years old and married to Edilberto.  She lives with her two daughters in an adobe house and produces organic cacao and achiote (a spice).  She has been supporting her parents with small tasks since she was a little girl, the farm being the family’s main source of support.  Having been elderly when she got engaged to Edilberto, who inherited some parcels of land from her parents, she began a life full of goals, such as buying an additional parcel of land as an additional product of her first years’ of work with her husband.  She wants to produce optimum cacao to sell but needs working capital to hire field hands and buy compost.

One of her greatest challenges is the constant attack from regional plagues that occasionally cause considerable damage to her crops, which she fights with natural repellants.  This will be her first loan through Kiva.  She is grateful for the opportunity and is committed to making her payments on time.  She will use the 3,000 PEN to make improvements to her home, beginning with the plumbing, drainage, and improvements to her corrugated roof.  The aim is to improve her family life.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: José Lucio

texts.es: José de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas; comercializa sus cosechas en los mercados de granos basicos cerca de su lugar de residencia. Don jose quiere aumentar la producción porque así aumentara sus ganancias, pero  necesita de capital para realizar la inversión por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, abono, herbicida, insecticida, etc. y asi el podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
José, 48, lives with his life companion in his own house.  He works growing corn and has worked in agriculture for several years so he’s gained quite a bit of experience that leads to better crop yields.  He sells his crops in basic grain markets located near where he lives.  

José needs to increase production because his profits will increase that way but needs capital to make the investment which is why he’s asking for a loan to buy corn seeds, manure, herbicide, insecticide, etc. to provide economic security for his home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 44 años, los escasos recursos económicos en su hogar no le permitieron continuar sus estudios después de haber concluido la primaria. Se casó con José que es un chofer profesional de 48 años y con quien tuvo un hijo nombrado como su padre y que es un adolescente de 17 años a quien esperan un día poder verlo recibir su título profesional. Gloria vive con su familia en una parroquia rural de la ciudad de Quito capital de la provincia del Ecuador, tras recorrer polvorientos caminos y respirar el aire puro del campo, Nanegalito, parroquia ubicada al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, que fue residencia de una cultura ecuatoriana y que conserva recónditas historias del antepasado de la cultura ecuatoriana. Es un lugar poseedor de diversidad de flora y fauna y además ríos y cascadas que son una fuente cristalina que atrae turistas nacionales y extranjeros, por los negocios que ofertan deportes extremos que a simple vista se puede ver que son manufacturados con mucha seguridad e ingenio. Otro medio de producción de la zona es la ganadería con la producción de leche y carne y también la agricultura con la producción de caña de azúcar, yuca, caña, maíz, naranjas, mandarinas y papayas. Las artesanías elaboradas a mano también son una oportunidad de negocio en el lugar, que son demandadas por el uso particular de materiales naturales como semillas del bosque. Por todo esto las autoridades locales se han preocupado por hacer instalaciones adecuadas para que todos sus más de 3000 habitantes tengan acceso a los servicios básicos a pesar de que fue una zona que en el pasado no fue muy tomada en cuenta, pues hasta hace poco, muchos no gozaban el beneficio de tener agua potable o luz eléctrica.
Gloria se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su cantón desde hace 10 años, lo hizo con el propósito de mejorar la situación económica en su hogar y juntamente con su esposo aportar a los gastos de educación, salud, vivienda y alimentación. Ella aprendió esta actividad desde muy joven cuando acompañaba a su padre a transportar las frutas que cosechaban en su pequeña finca hacia el mercado central del pueblo. Gloria no tiene un horario fijo, pues hay temporadas en donde la visita de turistas es grande e incluso le piden hacer recorridos que le llevan todo el día. Un de las tareas más complicadas en su trabajo es el conducir por las noches y en lluvia, pues en repetidas ocasiones las carreteras han sufrido daños que no permiten el paso de ningún vehículo. El sueño de Gloria es un día poder comprar una finca para dedicarse de lleno al cultivo y comercialización de productos agrícolas, pero mientras eso se cumple seguirá esforzándose por hacer un trabajo responsable en su vehículo el cual debe pasar por mantenimientos exhaustivos periódicos para poder ser matriculado y seguir legalmente considerado como un transporte público por las autoridades competentes, para lo cual Gloria solicita un préstamo que lo usará para este mantenimiento y trámites correspondientes para tener en regla el funcionamiento de su camioneta que día a día transporta pasajeros inclusive fuera del cantón. Gloria tuvo la oportunidad de conocer a Fundación Alternativa quienes le brindaron seguridad y confianza para poder realizar este préstamo, además la asesoría que recibe le servirá de mucho para administrar los recursos que mantiene hasta el momento y los que recibe como utilidad en su negocio. Esta mujer emprendedora motiva a quienes alrededor del mundo visitan el sitio web de Kiva para que sigan apoyando a tanta gente que necesita el apoyo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria, 44, was unable to continue with her schooling after completing elementary school due to her family’s scarce economic resources.  She married José, 48, who is a professional driver with whom she had a son who is named after his father and who is a 17-year-old adolescent who they hope someday receives his professional degree.

Gloria lives with her family in a rural parish in the city of Quito, capital of Ecuador Province.  Nanegalito is a parish located in northwest Pichincha Province that after traveling dusty roads leads to the pure air in the countryside.  It was home to an Ecuadoran culture which still maintains arcane ancestral stories from the Ecuadoran past.  It’s a place with diverse flora and fauna as well as rivers and waterfalls that are a source of crystalline water that attracts national and foreign tourists because of the extreme sports offered that are clearly designed with safety and ingenuity.  Another source of production in the area is cattle and milk as well as meat production.   In agriculture, sugarcane, manioc, corn, oranges, mandarins and papayas stand out.  Hand-made crafts are also a business opportunity in the zone; they are in demand because of the natural materials like forest seeds that are used to make them.  Because of all this, the local authorities have focused on providing adequate installations so that all of the more than 3,000 inhabitants can have access to basic utilities despite the fact that this zone in the past had been neglected; up to fairly recently they did not enjoy the benefits of potable water or electricity.

Gloria has worked for the last ten years providing transportation services in her canton.  She did so aiming at improving her home’s economic situation and helps her husband with education, health, and housing and food costs.  She learned this activity while very young when she’d accompany her father transporting fruit they grew on their small farm to the city central market.

Gloria does not have a fixed work schedule because there are high tourism seasons and sometimes some of her routes are day-long.  One of the most complicated chores she has at work is having to drive at night and in the rain because highways are often damaged preventing all vehicular traffic.

Gloria’s dream is to be able someday to buy a farm to work full-time in agriculture and selling farm products but until that dream is a reality she will continue striving to work responsibly with her vehicle which must be given periodic exhaustive service and maintenance in order to be licensed and be allowed by local authorities to continue to be used for public transportation.  This is why Gloria is asking for a loan she’ll use to service the vehicle and pay for the corresponding paperwork to have her vehicle she uses daily to transport passengers even beyond the canton in operating conditions.

Gloria learned about Fundación Alternativa who offered her security and trust to carry out this loan; she also got advice that will be very useful for her to manage the resources that she still retains and receives as profits in her business.  This enterprising woman motivates those who around the world visit the Kiva site so that they will continue supporting so many people who need support in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to service her vehicle.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Aracolpa Kañeblocke Añita Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Aracolpa Kañeblocke Añita, significa es un dialecto Indígena Mujeres Trabajando Unidas, es el nombre de este grupo de mujeres indígenas que cuenta con una amplia trayectoria con Fundación Mujer. Se formó en el año 2006, y han sido beneficiadas con 4 préstamos anteriormente. Cuenta con 8 socias, todas se dedican a la agricultura, también pertenecen a una Asociación de Mujeres Indígenas de la comunidad, que a través de estas organizaciones luchan por obtener mejores condiciones de vida.  
La líder del grupo es Doña Rafaela, una mujer de 44 años, casada por más de 25 años, y que problemas de salud no pudo tener hijos, su esposo trabaja como oficial de seguridad. Ella siempre ha trabajado en el campo, es lo que el gusta, siembra plátano y banano. Este nuevo préstamo se va a invertir en la compra de insumos como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas, bolsas pláticas, cajas de cartón y otros. Además ha sido la forma de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ya que el ingreso que el percibe es muy poco. Los créditos anteriores, le permitieron iniciar con la siembra de estos cultivos, así como ir creciendo con el paso del tiempo, hasta obtener un producto de muy buena calidad. 
Sus aspiraciones son aumentar el área de su plantación, y también asegurar un pequeño fondo de dinero para su jubilación.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Aracolpa Kañeblocke Añita means Woman Working Together in an indigenous dialect and is the name of choice of this group of indigenous women who have a long history with Fundación Mujer. The group was formed in 2006 and to date has been granted four loans. The group is made up of eight members, all of whom work in agriculture. The women also belong to their community's Indigenous Woman's Association and through these organizations fight for better living conditions. 
  
The leader of the group is 44-year-old Rafaela who has been married for over 25 years and who due to health problems could never have children. Her husband works as a security officer. Rafaela has always worked in the field; it is what she enjoys doing, and today she grows plantains and bananas. Rafaela will invest this new loan in supplies such as seeds, compost, fertilizer, insecticides, plastic bags and cardboard boxes, among others. This is her way of helping her husband with the household expenses as the income he earns is very little. The previous loans allowed Rafaela to begin planting her crops as well as to grow over the years until she obtained a quality product.
 
Rafaela's goals are to increase the area of her crop and to ensure she has a small fund for her retirement.

loans.use: buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, insecticides, plastic bags and cardboard boxes, among others.

loans.name: Miriam Janet

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que Miriam es padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Miriam no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Miriam trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y adicionalmente por época escolar vende útiles, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Miriam se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, como casacas, polos, pantalones, chompas y otros, de esta manera Miriam tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio y atenderá a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 30 year old woman.  She lives in the city of Ica in the Santiago district with her small son, whom she loves.  He is her main reason for living.  She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person.  She puts all of her efforts into getting her little one ahead.  This is because Miriam is father and mother to him.  

Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources and out of need, she has had to work ever since she was very young.  Miriam was not able to study for a professional nursing career, but she would have liked to have been able to do so.  In her free time she prepares a delicious ceviche to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with great determination and dedication, Miriam works in her small business of selling clothes.  Also, she sells supplies during the school season.  She works every day for approximately ten hours.  She believes that it is going well for her because of the good prices and the kind service that she offers her customers.

Miriam is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise.  She will buy things like jackets, tops, pants, sweaters, and others.

This way Miriam will have a better stocked business, and she will tend to more customers.  This way she will continue working and putting forth effort in order to achiever her big dream of becoming a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is 28 years old, a single man, and lives in Hodeida, Yemen. He is responsible for his parents and he supports them. He owns a small house. He is working in pharmacy getting a lot of experience. 

Currently, he is starting to open a pharmacy and needs money to cover his expenses. Due to the hot weather in Hodeida, he needs a loan to buy an air conditioner to use to cool medicines for his pharmacy. He applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. This loan will increase his profits to be able to cover the costs of necessities for his family.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner to use to cool medicines for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Rose has been working hard to manage her small local brew buiness, which sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sorghum, millet, and some other different drinks such as sodas and beer to sell. It will help Rose to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a cloth business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, millet, and drinks such as sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Esther is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past year, Esther has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, juice, cooking oil and beans. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize flour, rice, cooking oil and juice to sell in the store, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and help her family in buying basic needs. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her store into a wholesale shop. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, rice, cooking oil and juice to sell

loans.name: Zuena's Group

texts.en:
Zuena's group is comprised of 4 hard working women. Zuena is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Zuena has been working hard to manage her small clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Zuena has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy different types of clothes to sell, and will help Zuena to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Zuena hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Zuena is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes to sell

loans.name: Yanira Marisol

texts.es: Doña yanira de 42 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años y eso le ha dado la capasidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz y el sorgo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, doña yanira esta solicitando un credito para poder comparar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes asi como lo muestra en la fotografia entre otras cosas para tener una mejor cosecha y poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Yanira, 42, has worked in agriculture for the last ten years and this has given her skills and knowledge needed to care for her crops.  Her main crop is corn and sorghum.  She sells her crops to basic grain agencies located near her place of residence.  With profits obtained from her sales she helps to cover family expenses.  She lives with her husband and three children.

Yanira is asking for the loan to be able to buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and fertilizer, among other things that will help her with her crop yields as shown in the photo and to earn higher profits to continue helping with household expenses with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Santos Omar

texts.es: don santos de 36 años vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijo en casa propia, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como: tomates, papas, cebollas, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, chiles entre otros tiene 10 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Santos quiere realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas frutas y verduras por mayor, y asi poder obtener mas ganancias  para poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Santos, 36, lives with his wife and two children in his own house.  He works selling fruit and vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, strawberries, bananas, oranges and chilies, among others.  He has been in business for ten years which has given him much sales experience that allows him to earn the best profits.  The place he sells at is very strategically located for this activity and is very crowded with people since he has a large clientele that prefers him because his produce is fresh, well-priced and of high quality with excellent service.  Santos wants to make a new investment but does not have sufficient capital to back him up which is why he’s asking for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables at wholesale to earn higher profits to be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Pablo Valentin

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Pablo se encuentra una pequeña carrera técnica de Agronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Pablo trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos, el cual con ayuda de su madre puede atender, Pablo se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Pablo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un pequeño corral para sus cerdos, de esta manera Pablo podrá contar con un ambiente adecuado y seguros para sus animalitos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional y al lado de su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 20 year old, single man.  He lives in the city of Ica in the Santiago district with his parents and siblings.  He is a friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person with a strong drive to succeed.  Thanks to his efforts and the help of his parents, Pablo now has a small career in agriculture.  In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and on occasion he cooks a delicious rice with duck for his family.  

On his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Pablo works as a field laborer on a farm in his city.  Additionally, he has a small business raising and selling pigs with the help of his mother.  Pablo feels at ease doing his work, and believes that he is doing well due to his being responsible and the kind treatment that he gives to others.  

Pablo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to build a small pigpen, allowing him to have a suitable and safe environment for his animals.  With this, he will continue to work hard and strive to reach his goal of becoming a good professional and with his family, get ahead.

loans.use: To build a pigpen

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is a 21-year-old single man who has been in the transport industry for the last five years. He runs a motorcycle business. Firstly, he took a rental motorcycle to get daily income. Then, he accumulated some money but it isn`t enough to buy his own motorcycle.

He needs a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy new motorbike to increase his income. He hopes to use the increase in profits to buy an extra new motorbike. 

His dream is attain financial sustainability.

loans.use: to buy new motorbike to increase his income.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. Mohammed is a secondary school graduate. He is innovative and full of ideas, and marketing and advertising suits him well. He also has experience in marking and advertising. 

Mohammed started up a small business. He opened a small marketing agency seven months ago using the money he accumulated. He applied for a youth loan of 100.000 YER from AMB to buy papers, a new printer, ink cartridges, and some items for his agency. 

He looks forward to improving his living conditions and opening a savings account to collect money to open new branches for his agency in new areas.

loans.use: to buy papers, a new printer, ink cartridges, and items for his marketing and advertising agency.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. With the good reception that he received from his customers, he decided to open a clothing store in order to increase his income. He established his business one year ago.

Thanks to this activity, the quality of life of his immediate family has improved. With the idea of continuing to grow and to position him in the local market, he is requesting a youth loan in order to buy merchandise of ladies' clothes for his business. This will allow him to have a good supply to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy ladies' clothes for his business.

loans.name: Mahfooth

texts.en:
Mahfooth is 30 years old and from Ramallah.

He is married and has three children: two girls and a boy.

He has owned a carpentry business since 2013 and has one employee. He has 8 years of experience in carpentry through which he makes closets, beds, etc. 

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an electrical saw for his carpentry shop.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase his efficiency and thus improve his income.

loans.use: To buy an electrical saw for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 39-year-old single woman with 2 children. She makes and sells cooked noddles, donuts, etc. in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Hana needs a loan to buy more ingredients for her canteen. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's daily needs. Hana has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: To buy noodles, donuts, flour, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de  Darsalam dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des activités génératrices de revenu au marché Médine Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du riz, de la tomate et d’habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 10ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Koumba  (la 1ère  femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des céréales.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de riz. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Koumba  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Koumba a pour objectif de pérenniser ses activités dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The five women in the Sabougnouman group are all married and in monogamous families. They are on average 36 years old and have on average 3 children. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other from their businesses at the Médine Ségou market. The group members sell rice, tomatoes, and clothing. In the goal of growing  their business, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their tenth group loan. Mrs. Koumba (the first woman standing to the far right in the photo) has a big reputation in selling grains. She plans to use her loan to buy four bags of rice. She resells them for cash or credit from home to a clientele composed of men and women. Mrs. Koumba hopes to make 40,000 FCFA monthly with this loan, which will be used to reinvest into her business. Like the other women in the group, Mrs. Koumba hopes to build a long-term business partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build a new bedroom

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga is a 40-year-old widow with four children. She grows and sells cabbages, cucumbers and other items in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Faaiuga needs a loan to buy new equipment for her business. She plans to use her profits to help with her family’s everyday needs. Faaiuga has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, weed killer and gloves for use in her business.

loans.name: Leleaga

texts.en: Leleaga is 32 years old, married, and has five children. She runs a small business selling fresh fish in her community, as she has been doing for many years. Leleaga has applied for a loan to buy new tools for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leleaga will try and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a spear, a canoe, and a fishing net.

loans.name: Fetalaiga

texts.en: Fetalaiga is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Fetalaig needs a loan to buy more ingredients. She plans to use her profits to meet her family’s everyday needs. Fetalaiga has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, and a large cooking pot for her business making and selling pancakes.

loans.name: Alaine

texts.en: Alaine is 25 years old and single, without children. She makes and sells elei fabric prints to earn a living, as she has been doing for two years. Alaine has applied for a loan to buy tools and other resources to make her work a lot easier. She plans to use her profits to keep improving her business and also improve her family’s standard of living. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, a design board, and a paint brush for her elei fabric printing business.

loans.name: Siminya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est constitué de  quatre  femmes qui sont majoritairement veuves vivant dans leur famille. Elles ont en moyenne 45ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de  Darsalam Ségou qui est la 4ème Région administrative du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Médine Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de haricot, des fanes de niébé ou d’arachide et des corbeilles. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Dado (la 1ère  femme debout  de la droite vers gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fanes de niébé ou d’arachide à Darsalam. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2000 bottes de fanes de niébé ou d’arachide. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement d’hommes. Madame Dado  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Dado a pour objectif de pérenniser son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The group consists of four women, the majority of whom are widowed. They are on average 45 years old and have on average 4 children. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood in Ségou, which is the 4th administrative region of Mali. They know each other from their businesses at the Médine Ségou market. The group members sell beans, black-eyed peas, peanuts, and baskets. In the goal of growing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. Mrs. Dado (the first woman standing on right in the photo) has a big reputation in selling black-eyed peas and peanuts in Darsalam. She plans to use her loan to buy 2,000 bunches of black-eyed peas and peanuts. She resells them for cash or credit from home to a clientele composed mainly of men. Mrs. Dado hopes to make 40,000 FCFA monthly with this loan, which will be used to reinvest into her business. Like the other women in the group, Mrs. Koumba hopes to build a long-term business in her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy black-eyed peas and peanuts

loans.name: Rhugendekere Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bitulo est présidente  du collectif d’affaire Rhugendekere, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 41  ans, veuve et mère de 16 enfants. Son conjoint est décédé suite à une courte maladie. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme Toute fois, elle vend aussi la boisson. Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença cette affaire avec  le fonds reçu de son mari, quand ce défunt (alors son mari) travaillait au centre de recherche de Lwiro. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  20 bidons d’huiles de palme et 10 casiers de  boissons (Primus, Fanta, etc.). Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et accroitre l’entreprise. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien aux petits citoyens en microcrédit.
texts.en: The client, Bitulo, is the president of the business group Rhugendekere, an energetic entrepreneur, 41 years old, a widow, and mother to 16 children. Her spouse passed away after a short illness. The client sells palm oil. She also sells beverages. She sells these products from home. She started this business with the funds she got from her husband, when the deceased (her husband) was working in the research center in Lwiro. This new loan will help her buy 20 containers of palm oil and ten cases of beverages (Primus, Fanta, etc.). She hopes to send her children to school and grow her business. In the end, she greatly thanks Hekima for its support for little citizens through microloans.

loans.use: to buy 20 containers of palm oil and 10 cases of beverages (Primus, Fanta, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a new workshop

loans.name: Pedro Vicente

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Mala con su esposa y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Pedro no pudo culminar sus estudios secundario y una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Pedro trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida y raspadillas, adicionalmente también brinda servicios de albañilería, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, arena, madera y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder mejorar su local de ventas, ya que desea contar con un espacio adecuado y seguro para sus clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 40-year old man who lives in the city of Cañete, in Mala's district, with his wife and their three children, whom he loves and are his priority in life. He's a nice, hard-working and enthusiastic man and, together with his wife, he makes every effort to support his family. Unfortunately, the lack of financial resources and the need to start working at an early age didn't allow him to finish his secondary studies or to go to college. He likes cooking Lomo Saltado in his free time to share with his family. 

With a lot of determination and dedication, he took the initiative to start his own business selling food and slush. Additionally, he also offers bricklaying services. He works approximately 10 hours per day and believes things are going well thanks to his sense of responsibility and his kindness towards people. 

Pedro feels very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will purchase construction materials, such as cement, sand, wood and others, that he'll use to make improvements to his store. He wants to have an appropriate and safe space for his clients, and to keep working hard towards his dream of seeing his children becoming good professionals.

loans.use: to make improvements to his store.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est une femme âgé(e) de 41ans. Elle est veuve et a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Akoko travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 1987 Elle exerce l’activité au marché et sa difficulté est la mévente. Akoko a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut assurer l’avenir de son unique enfant et agrandir l’activité.
texts.en: Akoko is a 41-year-old woman. She is widowed and has one child, who attends school. Akoko has been selling pagnes (traditional wraps) since 1987. She does this at the market and she is suffering from a slump in sales. Akoko sought her third loan from WAGES in order to buy pagnes. She would like to ensure her only child’s future and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes

loans.name: Cristhian Ferrer

texts.es:
Cristhian es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y su hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayuda r a sus padres, Cristhian no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tallarín Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cristhian trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, adicionalmente también se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene un pequeño cultivo de tuna, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y experiencia.
Cristhian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción, mantenimiento y la compra de llantas nuevas para su mototaxi, de esta manera Cristhian tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su hogar construido con materiales adecuados, que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a 33 years old, lives in the city of Ica with his wife and son, whom loves and are his main reason for living.  He is a very kind and enthusiastic worker with a great desire to improve himself. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and his need to work from a young age to help his parents, Cristhian could not study for a proper career. In his spare time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and sometimes cooks a delicious "Tossed-Noodles" plate to share his family. On his own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Cristhian works as motorcycle taxi driver. He provides transportation services in his city.  He also works in agriculture, as he has a small crop of cactus pears.  He works everyday for approximately 10 hours and believes he is doing well considering he is experienced and responsible.  
Cristhian is grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to their assistance, he will be able to perform repairs and maintenance, as well as purchase new tires, on his motorcycle-taxi. This way, Cristhian will have his taxi in top condition, which will assure his work and help him strive for his dream to have a properly constructed home for the safety and security of his family.

loans.use: with the repair, maintenance and purchase of tires for his motorcycle-taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Leofao

texts.en:
Leofao is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children. She makes and sells cucumbers, cabbages, etc., in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Leofao needs a loan to buy new equipment for her business, including veggie seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and gloves. She plans to use her profits to provide for her family's daily needs. Leofao has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy veggie seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and gloves.

loans.name: Rajashree-A Group

texts.en:
Rajashree-A is a Joint Liability Group formed by five energetic women of Bhawanipatna town in Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. Pratima, standing second from the right with her hand raised, is the featured member. 

Pratima is 49 years old and lives with her husband, two daughters of eighteen and sixteen years old and two sons of twenty-two and twenty years. She hails from a poor family of south Odisha and migrated to western Odisha for business purposes. Pratima is a very hardworking lady having strong self-confidence.

Pratima has been running a dry fish wholesaling and retailing business for the last twenty years in her town and nearby villages, with the help of her husband and sons. She supplies dry fish in bulk to the retailers within a radius of twenty kms and covers four weekly markets for retailing. 

Pratima brings dry fish in bulk from the coastal belt of south Odisha, which is 350 kms away from her home town, and stores it up in her local storeroom. Her monthly net income from the present business is around 10,000 INR. According to Pratima, it is very hard to manage her big family and plan for the future development of her business with this small income. 

So, with the present loan, Pratima has planned to purchase more stock of dry fish for the coming lean season (June – September). She has a dream to construct a house for her sons and get her daughters and sons married in a respectable manner.   

The other four members of her group, Binapani, Anita, Annapurna and Puspa, are running a fruit stall, vegetable wholesaling, milk and general grocery shop businesses respectively.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish.

loans.name: Maa Sarala Group

texts.en:
Maa Sarala, a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2011 by four active women of Bhawanipatna town of Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Kalahandi is known for drought and backwardness. 

Jagyasini is one of the members of this group. She is standing on the extreme right with her hand raised in the photograph. She is a very energetic lady. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband and one daughter of five years, who has just stepped into school. The families of Jagyasini have migrated to this place from south Odisha in search of a livelihood. 

Jagyasini is running two businesses with the help of her husband. One is a daily needs shop and the other one is an ice cream factory, in business for the last seven years. Jagyasini supplies ice cream to 30 vendors on a daily basis. From the above two businesses, she earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR. With this small income, she hardly manages her family expenses. 

Summer season is the peak period for the ice cream business, so looking into the market demand, Jagyasini wants to increase the production of ice cream. So, from the present loan amount, she wants to purchase a compressor machine for her factory. This will help Jagyasini to increase the income and materialize her dream of giving an education to her girl child.

The other three members of the group are Sarojini, Taru and Rasmibala, who are running a coconut wholesaling business, an auto repairing center and a tailoring center respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor machine for her ice cream factory.

loans.name: Ateliana

texts.en:
Ateliana is a 41-year-old single woman with no children. She would like to start selling taro, bananas, etc. to earn a living. 

Ateliana has requested a loan to buy new equipment for her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Ateliana will spend her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, spades, fertilizer, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela, 58 years old, is engaged in a hog-fattening business to provide for the needs of her children. Now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy enough feeds and vitamins to provide better nourishment for her hogs, she hopes this measure will result in a higher income when she sells them.

Angela is highly motivated to improve the lives of her children, as she doesn't want them to experience poor living conditions throughout their lives.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 53 years old and married with five children.  She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Angelina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Angelina has been buying and selling livestock for three years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en: Flaviana is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk and selling motorcycle tools. This helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, cooking oil, soy sauce, sugar, coffee and biscuits. She opened her kiosk 1997 with her own working capital of $1,000. Flaviana is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle tools and equipment and goods for her kiosk: cooking oil, soy sauce, sugar, coffee etc.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es: Aquilino de sesenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y loroco, tiene 35 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro cuando su cosecha esta lista la va almacenado en los graneros que muestra en la foto para comercilaizarla en los diferentes mercados de la zona donde reside, tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, Don Aquilino quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, loroco, y fertilizante, para seguir sembrando y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabiliadad economica.
texts.en:
Aquilino is 66 years old. He lives with his life partner and their three children. He works growing corn and “loroco” (an edible flower native to Central America). He has been working in agriculture for 35 years so he has a lot of experience in the field. When his crop is ready it will be stored in the silos shown in the photograph to be sold in different markets in the area where he lives. He has good clientele because he obtains the best harvest.

Aquilino wants to increase production, but needs financial support and this is why he is asking for a loan in order to permit him to buy corn seed, loroco, and fertilizer, so he can continue planting and to be able to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, seed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old, married with four children and three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Editha has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Editha has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bale of shoes

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
Apolonia de 35 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa de madera , el cual construyo con mucho esfuerzo.Apolonia se dedica a la venta de comida y comenta que opto por esta labor puesto que los fines de semana se realizan diversas reuniones en su localidad y vio en ello una buena oportunidad de trabajo para asi expender pequeñas porciones de los platos mas populares en su zona como son el arroz con pollo y tallarines logrando asi generar buenos ingresos.
La idea partió por que tenía como principal oficio la producción de cacao orgánico en unas parcelas que adquirió con muchos años de trabajo, fue entonces que sufrió un leve accidente desempeñando las labores cotidianas y la obligaron a alejarse de las tareas productivas por un periodo prolongado; es así como obligada a llevar el sustento familiar decidió a manera de descanso incursionar en su actual negocio logrando hallar una nueva manera de ganarse la vida.Para no dejar inactiva la producción de sus parcelas viene alquilándolo a otros productores.Desea trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza a pesar de las adversidades y cumplir el sueño de aperturar un restaurante o pollería en su localidad.Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, agradecida nuevamente por confianza renovada se compromete a cumplir de manera responsable con sus cuotas.	
Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos de arroz, azúcar y demás insumos para seguir desempeñando su negocio.
texts.en:
Apolonia is a 35-year old woman who is married and has two children. She lives with them in her wooden house, which she built with a lot of effort. Apolonia makes a living from selling food, an activity that she chose when, at the meetings held on weekends in her town, she realized it was a good job opportunity. She sells small portions of the most popular dishes in her area, such as rice with chicken and noodles, and obtains good income. 

She used to work in organic cocoa production before, using plots she had acquired after many years of work. However, she had a minor accident while doing her daily job tasks and was separated from productive activities for a long period. Having the obligation to support her family, she decided to start her current business and found a new way to earn a living. She rents out her plots to other producers so that they are not inactive. 

In spite of adversities, she wants to work with the motivation that characterizes her and to make true her dream of opening a restaurant or a store in her town. This is her second loan with MFP and she's thankful again for the renewed trustworthiness. She commits to responsibly pay her installments, and is requesting 1,000 nuevos soles to buy rice, sugar and other supplies for her business.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar, oil and others.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 55 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Juliana has a variety store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juliana has been in this business for four years. In the future, Juliana would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Higinio

texts.es: José de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos; Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 13 años de dedicarse a la agricultura y eso le ha regalado experiencia muy valiosa, José es un hombre muy dedicado a su labor, responsable y honesto almacena su cosecha en los graneros que muestra en la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos en los mercados de venta de granos basicos cerca de su lugar de residencia, quiere invertir en insumos por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herramienta, etc. para poder obtener mejores cosechas y mejores ganancias que le ayuden a cubrir los gastos de su hogar
texts.en:
José, 44, lives with his life partner and two children. He is a farmer who grows corn and beans. He has been doing this agricultural work for 13 years and it has been a very valuable experience. José is very dedicated to his work and he's responsible and honest. He stores his harvest in his barn, which is shown in the photograph, to later sell them at the markets that sell staple crops, near his home. 

He wants to invest in supplies and for that reason he is requesting a loan, to allow him to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, tools etc... in order to be able to obtain better harvests and better profits which will help him to cover the expenses of his home.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, tools.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a computer gaming station.  Nida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Darwin  Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 22 años de edad es soltero vive con su mama en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia  Los Ríos. 


Es integrante de ventanilla Virgen De Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en La Parroquia Puerto Pechiche que pertenece al Cantón  Pueblo Viejo. 


Manuel se dedica a la venta de maíz, siembra de maíz y crianza de gallinas.

 Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y no perder los terrenos para los cultivos. 

Las compras se realizan en el comercial Montenegro. 

Su sueño es una mejor producción de los cultivos.

 El desafío que enfrenta es el trabajo y la quemazón. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Manuel is 22 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in the canton of Ventanas and the province of Los Ríos. He is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe group which is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche which belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. 

Manuel works selling corn, growing corn, and raising chickens. He is asking for a loan in order to pay the farm lease so he does not lose the land for the harvest. 

Purchases are made in Montenegro. His dream is a better crop production. The challenge that confronts him is the work and the intense heat. In his free time he enjoys sports.

loans.use: to pay the land lease so he does not lose the land for his crops

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 69 años de edad ,esta casado con Guillermina, con quien tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en la casa que compró hace 41 años.Hace mas de 24 años se dedica a realizar bellos bordados típicos de los pueblos aledaños a su zona, trabaja que desempeña por las noches ya que  que en el día cuida de sus animales como: cuyes, gallinas, posee gran cantidad de ellos, los cuales comercializa a los pobladores de su localidad, como también a una empresa exportadora de cuyes. Posee su propio capital de trabajo, sin embargo siempre le falta un poco para poder mejorar la calidad de sus animales. Reconoce que por el paso de los años ya no tiene esa misma fortaleza física y por eso le resulta complicado dedicarse a otras actividades, sin embargo trabaja con mucho esmero para poder mantener su negocio a flote y así obtener ganancias.
Juan, invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para nutrir a sus animales y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en: Juan, who is 69 years old, is married to Guillermina, with whom he has four children, who live with him in the home that he bought 41 years ago. For more than 24 years he has been making beautiful embroidery typical of the towns surrounding his area. He does that work in the evenings, since during the day he takes care of his animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. He has a great number of them, which he sells to the residents of his area, as well as to a business that exports guinea pigs. He has his own working capital, nevertheless he always needs a little to be able to improve the quality of his animals. He recognizes that with the passing of the years, he already does not have the same physical strength, and for that reason it takes a little longer to carry out the physical activities. Nevertheless, he works with great conscientiousness to keep his business afloat and thus obtain earnings. Juan will invest the 800 PEN in the purchase of balanced food to nourish his animals, and he promises to make his payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, de 31 años de edad, esta casada con David con quien tiene 5 hijos menores edad, ella vive junto a su familia en su casa apropia la cual pudo obtener gracias a los ahorros que juntó a lado de su pareja. Beatriz tiene como principal actividad de negocio la venta de uno de los platillos típicos más representativo del Perú que es el “Cebiche”. Para cumplir con esta función se dedica los fines de semana a la compra de pescado fresco regional principalmente  de la especie “doncella. Su local de atención está ubicado en la casa de su suegro cerca de un parque muy concurrido lo que le permite tener su clientela asegurada. Lleva en este negocio más de 5 años y por fortuna le va muy bien. Recibe la ayuda de su esposo y de su cuñada. Alterna su actividad con la venta de productos nutricionales durante sus ratos libres.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede distraerse al mismo tiempo que genera sus propios ingresos, además tiene tiempo para complementarlo con las actividades de su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucho empeño, ella por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará todos los ingredientes necesarios para preparar este suculento platillo como pescado fresco, limones, ají, condimentos, verduras y otros al por mayor .
texts.en:
Beatriz, 31, is married to David, with whom she has five minor children.  She lives with her family in her own house, which she managed to get thanks to the money she and her husband saved.

Beatriz's main business activity is selling one of the most representative traditional dishes of Peru, ceviche.  To do this she devotes her weekends to buying fresh regional fish, mainly "doncella" [coris julis].  Her business locale is in her father-in-law's house near a very busy park, which allows her to have guaranteed customers.

She has had this business for more than five years and fortunately it's going very well for her.  She has the help of her husband and her sister-in-law.  She alternates her job with selling nutritional products in her spare time.  What she likes about her job is she can entertain herself at the same she generates her own income.  She also has time to do household activities.

Currently she'll request 800 soles [PEN].  She's very happy to know she has some financial support that offers her the guarantee of continuing to work very hard.  She promises to continue being a punctual member with her payments.

With the amount requested she'll buy all the ingredients she needs to prepare this succulent dish, such as fresh fish, limes, hot peppers, condiments, vegetables, and other products wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fish, hot peppers, limes, and other products

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
A USD 1,000 loan is offered to Susana to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working income of USD 200. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like oil, slippers, detergent, soap, and rice to sell. Susana is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of business involvement and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, slippers, detergent, soap, and rice

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. Rosemarie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Magaly  Zulema

texts.es:
Magaly  tiene 24 años de edad es de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos vive con la familia en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.

  Es integrante de ventanilla Virgen De Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche  que pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Magaly se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de animales como las gallinas. 

Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y compra de insumos como abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas y otros.

 Las compras  realiza en el cantón ventanas  frecuentemente en agripag.

 Su sueño es mejorar la producción de los cultivos.   No s3e presenta ningún desafío. En el tiempo libre le gusta criar animales.
texts.en:
Magaly is 24 years old. She's in a common law marriage and has three children. She lives with her family in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.

She's a member of the "Virgen de Guadalupe" communal bank, which is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

Magaly is a farmer who grows corn and raises animals such as chickens.

She requests the loan in order to rent the farmland and to purchase supplies such as compost, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.

She makes her purchases in the canton of Ventanas, often from a company called Agripag.

Her dream is to improve production in her crops. She doesn't face any challenges. In her free time she enjoys raising animals.

loans.use: to rent the farmland and to purchase supplies such as compost, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Walingwaling

texts.en:
Walingwaling is 49 years-old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school.

Walingwaling works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more items such as sugar, sardines, shampoo and other groceries to sell.

Walingwaling has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Walingwaling aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sugar, sardines, shampoo and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 53 years old and widowed with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns PHP 8,000 every month. She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap, and noodles. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap, and noodles

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has three children. 

Anita is running a business in her house by selling fishermen’s equipment. She is making a good income from selling, and she wants to buy more fishermen’s equipment. 

She opened her business in 2009. Her husband is in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fishermen's equipment.

loans.name: Sherwin

texts.en:
Sherwin is 40 years old and married with one child. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Sherwin owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in his business for over four years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. He has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in his business.

loans.name: Melania Aurora

texts.es: Doña Melania, una señora que busca como salir adelante con sus hijos y esposo quien trabaja como conductor, para, uno de sus hijos está estudiando y ella espera apoyarlo siempre hasta que logre contar con un empleo, Melania se busca la vida vendiendo ambulante ropa y cosméticos. Ella necesita el crédito para mejorar su vivienda, haciendo un muro perimetral para obtener más seguridad en su casa ya que el barrio cada vez es más peligroso, aun deja muchos puntos de su hogar por mejorar pero por la falta de posibilidades económicas no ha podido realizar, tiene la esperanza de que algún día pueda lograrlo.
texts.en: Melania is a lady who's trying to get ahead alongside her children and her husband, who works as a driver. One of her children is studying and she hopes to support him all the way, until he succeeds in finding a job. Melania earns her livelihood by selling clothing and cosmetics door-to-door. She needs the loan in order to improve her home by building a boundary wall so that she'll be safer in her house, since the neighborhood has become increasingly dangerous.
