There are still many aspects of her house that need improving, but she hasn't been able to do that because of the lack of financial resources. She hopes to be able to accomplish that someday.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sand, bricks and gravel.

loans.name: Leonico

texts.en:
Leonico lives in Bliss, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He makes a living by providing transportation services, which he has done for ten years to support the needs of his three children. Leonico earns a monthly income of 15,000 PHP from this business. 

For a 65-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy except to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Leonico borrows 23,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair his transport vehicle used in his business, and to provide his children with a better education. 

Leonico became a part of GDMPC in 2010. His plan for the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his transport vehicle used in his business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 79 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Clarin, in Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 15 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee and noodles. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee and noodles

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en: Cresenciana is a widow with two children. She is 60 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a plot of farmland where she plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Cresenciana has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes for business progress.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 50 years old, married, with two children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he owns and operates a watch repair service in the local community. He has been in his business for over six years and earns PHP 6,000 every month. 

Ramil joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2009 and now he has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase additional materials for repairing watches. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for repairing watches.

loans.name: Mariela Annabelle

texts.es:
Mariela tiene 26 años de edad es de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos vive con la familia en el Cantón Ventanas  Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Virgen De Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Mariela se dedica a la venta de arroz, maíz, a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas. 

Solicita el crédito para la siembra de maíz, compra de insumos para el cultivo    y para mejorar el cultivo. 

Las compras lo realizan  en el Cantón Ventanas   frecuentemente.

 Su sueño es mejorar la producción  de   los cultivos.

 El desafío que enfrenta es combatir contra la naturaleza. 

 En el tiempo libre le gusta criar animales  y cuidar a los hijos.

0.
texts.en:
Mariela is 26 years old. She's in a common-law relationship and has 3 children. She lives with her family in Ventanas Canton, in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of Ventanilla Virgen De Guadalupe which is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish pertaining to Pueblo Viejo Canton. 

Mariela works selling rice and corn, growing corn, and raising chickens. She is requesting a loan to grow corn, buy supplies for the crop and to improve her crop. She frequently does her shopping in Ventanas Canton. Her dream is to improve crop production. The challenge she faces is to fight against nature. In her free time she likes to raise animals and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crop and to improve her crop.

loans.name: Roberto Alfredo

texts.es: Don Roberto de 56 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. don roberto desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y tambien poder darle una mejora a la parcela donde siembra sus cultivos. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Fifty-six year-old Roberto is a very responsible family man. He has always been known for giving his best to his children. He currently lives with his wife and their 2 children. He is a very hard worker who has always worked with joy and enthusiasm. 

He is a farmer. Every year he plants the main basic grains from the region: corn and beans. 

Roberto would like to increase his sales. To do so he is requesting a loan which will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides among other items. He will also be able to improve the plot of land where he plants his crops. 

He hopes to receive the help he is requesting because he does not have another source of income. This way he will continue putting bread on his family's table without limit.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is 46 years-old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production in the local community in order to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 45,000PHP every month. She has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 55,000PHP in order to purchase additional seedlings and chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal seedlings and chemicals

loans.name: Leodelyn

texts.en:
Leodelyn is 37 years-old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Leodelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leodelyn has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en: Anaclita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bamboo in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell to customers. Anaclita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Anaclita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Viginia

texts.en: Viginia is 51 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Clarin, in Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat) production in the local community. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase materials for copra production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase materials for copra production

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is 36 years old, married, and has 1 child. He lives in Clarin, in Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting coconuts to earn a living. He has been in his business for over 5 years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2009, and now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for coconut production. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for coconut production

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 64, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Milagros sells Vita Plus products. These are natural health drinks and foods. She also sells ready-to-wear products for men and women. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy Vita Plus products and RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Milagros hopes that her business will get bigger. She dreams that her children a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of Vita Plus products and ready-to-wear merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lumber-selling business in the Philippines. 

Cirila successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more lumber to sell to customers.

NWTF is presenting Cirila's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 53 years old and married with ten children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Lydia has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thirteen years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Lydia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more recycled materials to sell.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. Celsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is 43 years old and married with four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Marrieta owns and operates a food vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional snacks to sell like bananas, bread and ice juice. 

Marrieta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional snacks to sell like bananas, bread and ice juice.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Doña Ana vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 4 años de edad; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa, las cosechas que ha cultivado las va almacenado en los graneros que muestra en la fotografia, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, Ana es una mujer dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus cultivos para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her life partner and their two children who are 15 and 4 years old. She works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of corn and beans. She has worked in this field for many years and has much valuable experience. She stores the crops that she grows in the silos shown in the photograph. She sells in all the surrounding areas and she has many regular customers.

Ana is a woman dedicated to her work, a fighter always ready to work hard in order to achieve success. She wants to take advantage of the surge of her business to increase production and thus be able to have better profits. She needs to invest in supplies but needs funding and this is why she is asking for a loan to permit her to buy corn seed, beans, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc., and so be able to continue with her crops in order to obtain better earnings and give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
For the past three years Alma, who is married, has been working hard to support her family with her fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fishing nets for her enterprise.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
Rolanda is 49 years old and married with one kid in school. Rolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Rolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell.

Rolanda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Rolanda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
This is Shiela. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Shiela dreams that her business will continue to progress. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Merliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merliza works hard to support her family.

She has a cashew seed vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Merliza is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of cashew seeds to sell in her cashew seed vending business.

Merliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of cashew seeds to sell.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia, a 48-year-old married woman, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she has cultivated bananas for sale to make a living for 10 years now. It normally gives Virgilia a monthly income of 8,000 PHP. Having joined GDMPC in 2011, she has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She's dreaming of augmenting her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa. She previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jesusa dreams to have more jeepneys to expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines. They were originally made from US military jeeps left over from World War II and are known from their flamboyant decoration and crowded seating. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. They have become a ubiquitous symbol of Philippine culture. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Doña Evangelina de 36 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la va alamcenando en los graneros que muestra en la fotografiapara luego salir a comercializarlos con las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar ella solicita un credito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbisidas y foliares y poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su esposo y sus hijos
texts.en: Evangelina, 36, lives with her husband and her 2 children in her own home.  She has been working as a farmer for a number of years.  When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the silos that are seen in the photograph, and then later she goes out to sell her products. With her earnings, and with the help of her husband, she manages to cover the household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to purchase organic fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and leaf fertilizer so that she can continue with her harvests and obtain better earnings.  This way, she can have a better life with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (seeds, fertilizers, etc.)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana De 47 años de edad se madre soltera y vive junto en sus dos hijos en su casa contruida a base de adobe.Inicialmente se dedicaba a la  producción de cacao orgánico y teniendo como lugar de residencia un anexo cercano a sus cultivos , logro trabajar y acumular capital que le permitió edificar su vivienda en la parte urbana de su localidad.El motivo por el cual dejo las actividades agrícolas fue el de brindarle una buena educación y mayor atención a sus hijos.Uno de los oficios que optó para sustentar la economía de su hogar fue el de aperturar una tienda de productos comestibles en un ambiente cómodo de su vivienda el cual viene desempeñando desde hace 5 años.Es común observar su negocio siempre surtido, no obstante es necesario contar con capital de respaldo para así mantener siempre la afluencia de clientes.Dentro de los productos con mayor demanda podemos hallar arroz, azúcar, cereales, enlatados y golosinas además de bebidas heladas.Espera con el tiempo trabajar de manera fluida y cumplir uno de sus objetivos que es la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble e iniciarse en el alquiler de cuartos por periodo prolongado a estudiantes y profesionales de la zona.Este es  su primer crédito con Kiva motivo por el cual agradece la confianza y oportunidad brindada.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará mas productos para abastecer su negocio tales como sacos de arroz, azúcar, conservas de pescado, enlatados de leche, galletas y gaseosa,entre otros .
texts.en:
Juana is a 47-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in a sun-dried brick house. She used to produce organic cocoa and lived in an annex close to her crops. She managed to earn a capital which allowed her to build her house in the urban part of her locality. She quit farming to pay more attention to her children and give them a better education. To provide for her family, she opened a grocery store in a nice part of her home and has been working there for 5 years.
Her business is usually well stocked, but she needs to have some backup capital to maintain the customer turnout. The products in highest demand are rice, sugar, cereals, canned goods and sweets, as well as cool drinks.
She hopes to maintain a good work flow and achieve one of her goals, to build a house with noble materials and rent rooms long term to students and professionals in the area.
This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the trust and the opportunity she is being offered.
With the 2,000 nuevos soles she will purchase more products to stock her store such as sacks of rice, sugar, canned fish, canned milk, biscuits and soda, among others.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, canned fish and others.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 48 years old and the widowed mother of five children.

Clarita is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds.

Clarita has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, wood, seaweed seeds, etc. for her seaweed culture business.

Victoria has been in this business for 2 years. Victoria earns more income from food vending.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, wood, seaweed seeds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products (medicines) to sell

loans.name: Komitsé

texts.fr: Âgé de 28ans, Komitsé est un jeune revendeur de bouteilles de gaz dans une boutique. Il sollicite son second crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il désire développer son activité et assurer au mieux à ses besoins. Il a démarré en 2010.
texts.en: Komitsé, aged 28, is a young reseller.  He resells bottled gas in a shop.  He is requesting his second loan to purchase some merchandise.  In the future, he would like to develop his business and to meet his own needs to the best of his abilities.  He started in this business in 2010.

loans.use: to buy gas bottles and accessories.

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
After having successfully repaid the previous loan, the Dana Kerti group decided to continue the loan and each is getting 1.5M-2M IDR. The group chose a new head because Jro Ayu resigned. Desak Gede was chosen as the new head. With full support from their husbands because it is considered beneficial to the family economy, they hope that the bussines will run smoothly. With 8 members, the group has a new loan of 14M IDR.

Desak Gede received 2M of loan use this loan to buy 3 piglets for fattening. Desak Gede is hoping to gain more profit than the previous loan which only made a profit of Rp. 300,000 per month. The loans help Desak Gede to develop the business and of course increase the family income. She hopes she can renovate her kitchen from the profit of the business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, tiene 44 años , es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 7 años respectivamente .Maximiliana se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico, palillo y achiote desde hace 20 años y contando con el apoyo de su esposo logró trabajarla y convertirla en el principal sustento de su economía familiar.En sus inicios fue algo complicado obtener una producción deseada puesto que no contaban con capital de trabajo que le permitiera contratar trabajadores del lugar, sacos de abono orgánico y plantones de almácigo para lograr una producción óptima.Con el paso de los años el precio de este producto presentó algunos incrementos el cual fue motivo para acumular capital necesario logrando cumplir sus objetivos a mediano plazo, siendo uno de ellos la construcción de su vivienda.El campo es una labor muy reconfortante donde ha logrado mantener a su familia brindándole lo necesario para una buena calidad de vida posible.Este es su primer crédito otorgado por Kiva ,esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con los 3,000 nuevos soles contratará trabajadores del lugar para iniciar la temporada de cosecha correspondiente a este año .
texts.en:
Maximiliana, 44, is married and has two children, 7 and 10 years old respectively. Maximiliana has worked in the production of organic cacao, turmeric and achiote for the past twenty years. 

Through her husbands support she was able to work and convert it into the mainstay for the family economy. 

In the beginning, it was difficult to get the desired yield since they did not have working capital needed to hire day laborers, bags of organic fertilizer and nursery seedlings.

With time the price of the products went up which allowed them to gain the needed capital to reach their medium term goals. One of them being constructing their own house. 

Working in the field is very rewarding. It has allowed her to maintain her family, giving them what is needed to have a good quality of life. 

This is her first Kiva loan. She is very grateful for the opportunity she has been given and is committed to paying her installments on time. 

With the 3,000 PEN [$1150] she will hire day laborers so she can start this years harvest season.

loans.use: To hire day laborers.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 9,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise products like clothes for men, women and children. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorna dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise for men, women and children's clothes needed in her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 65 years old and widowed with seven children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling flowers in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. 

Norma joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase chemicals for flowers to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for flowers to sell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta is 46 years old, married with 9 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns 35,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and is requesting a loan of 45,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan.  She previously used a 24,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for expenditures (personal, household, and business). 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory.  The more items displayed in her store the better, as more items will result in better profit.  Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan dreams to have a grocery store and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Leova

texts.en:
Leova is 33 years old and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines.  Leova requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items including canned goods, soap, noodles, and eggs.

Leova has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 6 years.  She also earns additional income by selling rice and charcoal.  Leova aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such as canned goods, soap, noodles, and eggs.

loans.name: Deocena

texts.en:
Deocena is 36 years old, married with 4 children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Deocena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Deocena has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Deocena has been in this business for twenty years.  In the future, Deocena would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is requesting a loan of P8,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccine for her hogs. She wants to develop and grow her hog fattening business, to earn higher proceeds. She is carefully managing this source of income in order to improve their living situation for her children.  Nenita hopes that she will enhance their standard of living through her loan requests.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela is 35 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a general store in the Philippines.  She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store (ie. groceries, shampoo, etc).  Adela has been in this business for seven years.  In the future, Adela would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been reselling frozen products in the Philippines for 5 years.  She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen products to sell.  Lorelie also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Lorelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen products to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy additional stock of a variety of products and she was able to generate more income. This has been her business for ten years. She and her husband are working together to provide income for their everyday needs. She would like to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more products to increase her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Thelma dreams of continuous success in her business. She meets her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business like wood, nails, paints, etc. for her furniture making business.

Nelita has been in this business for 20 years. Nelita earns more income from farming rice, raising livestock and selling dried fish and bananas.

Nelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business like wood, nails, paints, etc.

loans.name: Deoagracia

texts.en:
Deogracia works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Deogracia is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to  buy blouses, pants, shoes and slippers to sell to customers.

Deogracia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shoes and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is 56 years old, married with 1 child. She lives in Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 10,000PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC since the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000PHP to purchase fertilizer for small crops. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for small crops

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 59 years old, married mother of two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Estrella has a general store in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF, to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Estrella has been in this business for five years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough, to bring financial stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 64 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling food in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. 

Remedios joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients.

loans.name: Delfina Perlita

texts.en:
Delfina Perlita is a single mother from the village of San Mateo.  She is able to work hard and raise enough money to raise her children and address the needs of her family.  She managed a store for five years.  In order to maintain her store, she is asking for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, snack foods, and spices. 

Delfina Perita hopes that her business will expand so that she can sustain the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, snack foods, and spices for her store.

loans.name: Sherlene

texts.en:
Sherlene is 31 years old and married with four children who are in school, Sherlene works very hard to provide for them. Sherlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF, to buy additional stock like spices, soap, shampoo, milk, can goods, etc.for sale at her store

Sherlene has been in this business for 10 years. In the future Sherlene would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like spices, soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, etc for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 38 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Helen has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, shampoo and other groceries. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hollow blocks making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sand, gravel and cement, etc., for her hollow blocks making business. Esther has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from her general store.

Esther successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her hollow blocks and general store business. Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sand, gravel and cement, etc., for her business

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 48-year-old married mother of seven, two of whom are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Luciana has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Luciana has been in this business for 25 years.  In the future, Luciana would like to save enough money to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en: Repeka is 55 years old and married with one child. She has a small garden where she grows taro crops, yams etc that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Repeka needs a loan to buy new equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Repeka will use the profits from her sales to help with her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, chemicals, spades, and bush knives

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business.  She was able to buy more products for her variety store and generate more income.  This is her business for fifteen years.  She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better, as this will result in more profit.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma hopes for continued success in her business.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en: Shirly is 42 years old and married with 2 children.  She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She owns and operates a copra business to earn a living.  She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns 15,000 PHP every month.  She joined GDMPC in 2010 and has now requested a loan of 24,000 PHP to purchase additional materials to make copra.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for making copra.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 44 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 8,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and sales and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of goods in bulk to sell from her general store

loans.name: Bay

texts.en: Bay is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a worker in a printing shop. She has been running a cafe and general store in front of her house for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Bay is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more foods and many kind of soft drinks so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy foods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ganbileg

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbileg is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  The family currently resides in a rental apartment.  Mr. Ganbileg has been running an automobile repair shop since 2009 and had purchased all of the necessary equipment from China.  His wife has been working at a grocery store before selling clothes at a trade center.  

His wife is pregnant and needs some work near her home.  In 2009, he purchased an old wooden house and land from someone and this year he decided to move into this house.  So he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, bricks, foam, and planks.  Using those materials, he can repair and update his old wooden house.  The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and release less smoke, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials for his house.

loans.name: Jaya Usaha Baluk Group

texts.en:
Evaluated the last period, the Jaya Usaha Baluk group decided to continue their loan through MUK.  They still need the loan to increase their business and they will stop after saving enough capital to run the business on their own.

Ni Nengah will use her loan to purchase 2 superior piglets.  To reduce the cost, she feeds a mix feed made from various kinds of leafs, such as banana leaf.  She hopes that in the next 5 month the pigs will grow healthy and earn a satisfactory price.  All the profits will be saved for the business.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 43 years old and married. He has a daughter and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a doctor.

He has run a general store at his house for eight years. He sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery and some household electrical goods. He intends to use his loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his child's education

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar and sanitation items to stock his general store.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with her two sons and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker at a food factory. For four years, she has been running a tailoring business to make clothes for people in her community.

Sang would like a loan to purchase a better quality sewing machine to make better clothes. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Be

texts.en: Be is requesting a new loan to buy materials to make doors and windows. Be's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more materials to increase her production of doors and windows.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as households items and soft drinks, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Linh hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy household items and a variety of soft drinks to stock in her store

loans.name: Duc

texts.en: Duc is requesting a new loan to buy food and ingredients to make food for selling. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing his sales. He also hopes that through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food and ingredients to make many kinds of dishes to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
This is Carmelita, 50, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Danilo and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. They are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Carmelita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Carmelita hopes that her business will grow bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long would like to take a further loan to buy hairdressing tools to equip her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her barber shop

loans.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está empezando a trabajar juntos, estas señoras se encuentran  en su primer ciclo, están con muchas ansias de aprender y crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Matilde, quien tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa, el cual es una despensa. Es una vendedora muy buena y comenta que le está yendo muy bien en su negocio gracias a que siempre tiene productos de buena calidad y a buen precio. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana tener un negocio más amplio.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de manzanas, bananas, piñas, leche, panes, carnes, etc., lo que le ayudará a tener una mejor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is just beginning to work together.  These women are currently in their first cycle and are very eager to learn and grow, not only financially, but also as women.  
One of the members, Matilde, runs a small grocery store from her home.  She is a good saleswoman and she says that her business is going very well due to the fact that she alway has high quality products at good prices.  Her dream is to continue to grow and to have a larger business soon.  Matilde is requesting this loan in order to purchase apples, bananas, pineapples, baked goods, meat, etc., which will help her have a wider variety to offer to her clients.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, pineapples, milk, baked goods, meat, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 50 years old and has been in the business of buying and selling vegetables. The 15 years of operating this kind of occupation serves as her instrument to uplift their poor living condition. Despite her age, she pursues her business to achieve success in financial matters. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy a variety of vegetables such as potatoes, cabbage, squash, string beans, bitter melon and camote tops. This will be a big factor in further improving her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 42 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for many years. Victoria has requested a loan to purchases ingredients for her BBQ. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Victoria will help with her children's education and provide her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, soy sauce, onions and a gas oven,.

loans.name: Oyunbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunbayar, 53 years old, lives with her only daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been teaching at a local health science university for 31 years and is renowned for her extraordinary teaching ability. In 2010, she began to run a pharmacy near her home in order to generate more income. Her daughter helps her to operate the pharmacy. 

Mrs. Oyunbayar is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT) to purchase medicine in large volume. As a result, she can continue to run the pharmacy without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for her only daughter.

loans.use: to purchase medicine in large volume

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, rice, noodles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado VICTORIA está en su ciclo 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Según la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, las 10 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de la pobreza y trabajan por mejorar la economía de sus familias. En la foto de este grupo aparecen 11 personas ya que hay miembros de comité que no retiran crédito, pero que si forman parte del grupo y firman con sus compañeras.
Santa forma parte de este grupo, ella trabaja en la venta de ropas y de cosméticos, comenta que se esfuerza cada día mas por ir creciendo, ya que sabe que trabajando es la única forma en la que podrá ayudar a su familia. Su meta es que con la ayuda de su grupo todas puedan mejorar sus vidas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas y de cosméticos para tener una mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group names Victory (Victoria) is in their first cycle of the program with a committee of women, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead.  According to the survey on the elimination of poverty, the 10 find themselves below the poverty line, and are working to improve the economic situation of their families.  In this group photo there are 11 people because there are members of the group that are not taking out a loan, but they do form part of the group and sign with their colleagues.    

Santa is a member of this group.  She works at a business selling clothing and cosmetics, and she says that she works hard every day even more so as to continue growing.  She already knows that working is the only way for her to be able to help her family.  Her goal is that with the help of this group, they all can make their lives better.

She is asking for this credit to invest in buying more clothing and cosmetics to have a greater variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Lorena, es comerciante, hace trabajos de centro de mesas, además de eso también vende perfumes, artículos de mercería y productos de limpieza. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que hace de todo y está luchando por crecer.
Quiere ayudar a sus familiares, es por eso que lucha día a día. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y dando a sus seres queridos todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de perfumes, artículos de mercería  y demás, para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes toda la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
Lorena is a saleswoman.  She makes table centerpieces and also sells perfumes, sewing supplies and cleaning products.  She is a very hard-working person who would like to get ahead in life.  For this reason, she does a bit of everything and works hard to grow her business.

Lorena would like to help her family members and this is why she works hard every day.  Her goal is to be able to continue working and providing her loved ones with everything they need.  She is requesting this loan to buy perfumes, sewing supplies and other products so that she can continue offering her customers the large variety of goods they are used to.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, sewing supplies, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Valientes está en su ciclo número 20 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, es un grupo ya antiguo, pero que luchan por mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una de ellas.
Las integrantes del grupo están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les ayuda a saber cómo está la economía de cada una de las integrantes.
Ramona es parte de este grupo, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza no tan bajo, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y comenta que ella hace comidas para la venta, y que por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para una buena vida sin privaciones.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para sus comestibles, ya que le está yendo muy bien y quiere poder seguir con sus ventas y mejorando su economía.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Valientes" are in their 20th cycle of the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to prosper.  It's now an older group, but they fight to improve each of their living conditions.  

The group's members are currently undergoing the poverty elimination survey, which helps to identify the financial situation of each member.

Ramona is a member of the group and, at the last survey, she was not at such a low level of poverty.  Her situation is improving but equally she knows that the work and effort she puts in must be constant.  She tells us that she makes foods to sell and through this work she has helped her family and given them what they need, so that they do not have to go without.

Ramona is applying for a loan to invest in buying food supplies. The business is going very well and she wants to continue selling and improving her finances.

loans.use: to buy food supplies such as meat, chicken, ham, cheese, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna. She previously accessed a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her children’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures.

Edna would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edna dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she draws strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Orden Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Orden y  progreso está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual mide el ingreso de cada una de las miembros, y muestra que gracias al esfuerzo que todas han hecho ya ninguna se encuentra con un ingreso muy bajo, pero tienen el compromiso de seguir trabajando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eugenia, quien se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, como ser para mate y terere, los cuales son bebidas tradicionales del país. Gracias a que ella es muy trabajadora ha mejorado mucho su economía, y esta consciente de que trabajando es la única forma en que podrá seguir creciendo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Y solicita de este crédito para la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas y dando a su familia todo lo que está a su alcance, a la vez que podrá seguir mejorando su economía.
texts.en:
The Orden y Progreso Group is in its third phase of the Women Entrepreneurs Committee Project.

They are part of the poverty elimination program which measures the income of every one of the members. It shows that thanks to the effort everyone has put in, no one now has a very low income but are committed to keep working. 

Eugenia is one of the members who sells natural remedies such as mate tea and terere [cold mate tea drink] which are traditional drinks of the country. 

Due to her being very hard working, she has improved her economic situation and she is aware that working is the only way to keep growing. She is a hard working person and a fighter. 

She is asking for the loan to buy natural remedies to sell so that she can keep selling and giving her family everything that is within her reach and at the same time improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is 30 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice-cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy ingredients. In the future, Akenese hopes to earn more to provide for her family's needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, mix flavour, ice, and foam cups.

loans.name: Nuevas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Nuevas Emprendedoras está en su ciclo 1, donde todas van a  trabajar y se ayudarse por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual es un medio que les ayuda a saber como esta la economía de cada una de ellas, y las de sus familias. En su mayoría el grupo esta en un intermedio, es decir, no se encuentran con un nivel de ingresos muy bajo, pero tampoco estan en un nivel alto.
La Sra. Elisa, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 2,  cuenta que se dedica a la venta de sabanas, fundas, ropas para estancias, camisas de oficina, y todo tipo de prendas que ella misma confecciona con gran habilidad. Comenta que gracias a la buena calidad de las prendas que hace es que está creciendo y saliendo adelante y se ha hecho de muy buena clientela.
Elisa solicita de este crédito para la compra de Telas para poder producir más de los productos que vende, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nuevas Emprendedoras is in its first cycle, where all of them are going to work and help each other to move forward. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, which is a measure that helps the group to know how each of them and their families are doing economically.  Most of the group is at an intermediate level, which means, their income levels aren't really low, but neither are they very high.  
Elisa, who in her last survey was at poverty level 2, says that she works selling sheets, pillowcases, slipcovers, office shirts, and all kinds of garments that she skillfully sews herself. She says that thanks to the good quality of the garments she makes, she is growing and moving forward and she has gained many good customers. She is asking for this loan to buy fabric to make more of the products that she sells, which will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.ru:
Лорета родилась 1968. в городе Капан . Лорета замужем и имеет двух дочерей,младшая дочь Лореты замужем и живет отдельно от родителей. 
Муж Лореты строитель и находится на заработках в России. 
Лорета с 2009 года занимается продажей одежды. Сейчас Лорета арендуе помещение на ярмарке в родном городе Капан и продает одежду которую раз в месяц привозит с оптовых рынках Еревана и соседних стран. В бизнесе ей помогает старшая дочь которая финансист по специальности. За эти долгие годы работы в сфере продажы одежды у Лореты уже есть множество постоянных клиентов которые предпочитают купить одежду и обувь для всей семьи с магазина Лореты. 
В таких маленьких городах как Капан очень трудно женщинам найти работу и заботится о семье и Лорета очень счастлива что может сама справится с этими трудностями,но как она призналась без помощи мужа который работает за рубежом она бы одна не справилась. 
Капан один из самых южных городов Армении и там практически не бывает весны и с апреля месяца там уже летняя погода, и по этому Лорета решила привезти крупную партию летней одежды из Еревана чуть раньше.Лорета просит от кредиторов Кива кредит на сумму 2,400 Американских долларов для покупки женской, мужской и детской одежды,спальный пренодлежностей и обуви для перепродажи в Kапане.
texts.en:
Loreta was born in 1968 in the city of Kapan.  Loreta is married and has two daughters.  Loreta's younger daughter is married and lives separately from her parents.  Loreta's husband is a construction worker and is away in Russia earning money.

Loreta has been selling clothing since 2009.  Right now Loreta rents a stall at the market in her native city of Kapan and sells clothing that she brings monthly from the wholesale markets in Yerevan and neighboring countries.  Her older daughter, who is a financial analyst helps her with her business.  After many years of selling clothing Loreta has a lot of regular customers who prefer to buy clothing and shoes for their families from Loreta's store.  In small cities like Kapan it is very difficult for women to find job and to take care of their families and Loreta is very happy that she can handle these difficulties on her own, but as she admitted without her husband's help, who works abroad, she would not have been able to manage.  

Kapan is one of the southernmost cities in Armenia and there is almost no spring there, starting in April it is already summer weather there and this is why Loreta decided to purchase a large lot of clothing from Yerevan a little bit earlier.  Loreta is asking Kiva lenders for a loan of 2,400 US dollars for the purchase of women's, men's and children's clothing, sleeping attire and shoes for resale in Kapan.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of men’s, women’s and children's summer clothing and shoes for resale in her stall in Kapan city

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is a 43-year-old who wishes to provide for the needs and demands of her two children. But, because of poor living, everyday allowances are still hard for her to provide. She felt at fault, so she really worked harder. She is currently engaged in a hog fattening business from which she makes an income for their living. She wants to increase her sales in order to lessen the burden in financial matters. Now, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feeds and three additional hogs. She wishes for this to provide a better income in order to avoid lack of allowances for her children so they can concentrate on their studies.

loans.use: to buy feeds and three additional hogs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda. She previously accessed a 30,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Yolanda would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better! More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda hopes for continuous success in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
This is Annabel, 41, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Luis, a vendor, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annabel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Annabel dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y la generosidad de sus pobladores. Marleny es una joven de condición humilde pero con muchas ganas de progresar es por ello que a pesar de las adversidades Marleny trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar y también apoya a sus sobrinos que también viven en su casa; Marleny cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo honrada.

Marleny está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar los útiles escolares para sus sobrinos como cuadernos, libros, uniformes, entre otros, de esta manera sus sobrinos podrá asistir a la escuela con los materiales necesarios y ella podrá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder brindarle una buena educación a sus sobrinos y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Marley is a young woman who is 20 years of age. She lives in the District of Parcona, which is known for its warm climate and the generosity of its people. Even though she comes from a humble background, Marleny has the desire to make progress despite the adversity she has faced. She is employed as a farm worker at an estate in her city. Marleny works approximately nine hours a day and her work enables her to support her family and pay for the household expenses. In addition, she provides for her nephews who also live at her house. Marleny believes she is moving forward because she is responsible, and above all, honest.

She is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy school supplies for her nephews such as notebooks, books, uniforms, and other items so that they can attend school with the things they need. Marleny continues to strive forward each day so that she can fulfill her greatest wish of providing a good education for her nephews, which would enable them to study for a university degree.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, uniforms, and other school supplies for her nephews.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley engages in a sari-sari store business in their village. She sells biscuits, beverages and condiments like cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce. Shirley wants to extend the range of items she presently sells. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy spices, powdered juice, canned goods and soft drinks. In the future, Shirley will uplift their standard of living through her hard work and her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, powdered juice, canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Juan Oswaldo

texts.es:
Juan tiene 40 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos vive con la familia en el  Canton Ventanas Provincia Los Rios.

Es integrante de ventanilla virgen de Guadalupe  que se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Canton Pueblo Viejo.

Juan se dedica a la venta de chanchos, siembra de maíz y arroz, y a la crianza de gallinas y vacas.

  Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y compra de insumos.  

 Las compras lo realiza en Ventanas y Quevedo. 

 Su sueño es hacer mas desmonte y tener un negocio.

   El desafío que enfrenta es la cinta roja y otros.  

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old, married, and has five children. He lives with his family in the canton of Ventanas, which is in Los Ríos Province.

Juan is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Guadalupe”, which is in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. He sells pigs, grows corn and rice, and raises chickens and cows. Juan is requesting a loan to pay the rent of his farmland and to buy supplies. His purchases are conducted in Ventanas and Quevedo.
